intro: Arachnites monorchis, commonly known as the single-ovary water lily, is a aquatic plant belonging to the family Nymphaeaceae. It is characterized by its floating leaves that are typically heart-shaped or rounded with a waxy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Its roots are anchored in the mud at the bottom of still water bodies. Arachnites monorchis plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
